required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Study With [11C]AZ12713580 to Determine Central mGluR5 Receptor Occupancy of AZD2066
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Non-randomized Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Study With [11C]AZ12713580 to Determine Central mGluR5 Receptor Occupancy of AZD2066 After Oral Administration to Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The study is carried out in order to determine the relationship between AZD2066 exposure and mGluR5 receptor occupancy in the brain and to demonstrate that AZD2066 can displace [11C]AZ12713580 from mGluR5 binding-sites in the Central Nervous System

primary_outcome.measure: Positron emission tomography using the radioligand radioligand [11C]AZ12713580

secondary_outcome.measure: To investigate the safety and tolerability of AZD2066 by assessment of Adverse Events (AEs), vital signs measurements (blood pressure and pulse), electrocardiogram (ECG), physical examination, clinical chemistry, haematology and urinalysis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 visits with tests for all subjects. Some tests will be done several times per visit. All tests will not be performed at every visit.
15 times per subject. Up to 48 hours each time

intervention.description: single dose of oral dose, 3 times per subject
single dose of iv administered 4 times per subject (3 times together with AZD2066)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of informed consent
- BMI (Body Mass Index) of ≥19 to ≤28 kg/m2 and weight of ≥50 to ≤100 kg
- Normal MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) scan at visit 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of previous or ongoing psychiatric disease or condition including psychosis, affective disorder, anxiety disorder, borderline state and personality disorder according to the criteria in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
- History of psychotic disorder among first degree relatives (parents, siblings)
- History of use of antipsychotic, antidepressant or anxiolytic (anxiety treatment) drugs, prescribed or non-prescribed use. History of antidepressants or anxiolytics for non-psychiatric conditions such as pain or post-operative insomnia is allowed

overall_official.affiliation: Astrazeneca Clinical Pharmacology Unit, Stockholm, Sweden
AstraZeneca R&D, Study Delivery, Clinical Development, Södertälje, Sweden

responsible_party.name_title: Rolf Karlsten, MD, PhD, Medical Science Director, Emerging Analgesia
